title: Remember when you had a 1v1 laning phase top lane that lasted longer than 2:30 minutes?
body:
Right now lane ends the moment junglers show up lvl 3 at 2:30 with double buffs and full health while im still lvl 2.

Its fun being a sack of gold/free snowball ticket for the other jungler, i also like my top lane matchups being decided by which jungler ganks top lane first with the broken powerspike.

"but just play safe BRUH", yeah let me sit at tower until they slow push a big wave to dive and then im out of the game, what if im playing a early game champ vs say, nasus? Just let him free farm because junglers exist and are broken? "just dont play the game" is not acceptable counterplay.

Make it so junglers cant gank that early by increasing the camps damage to champs, massively reduce the Exp from first clear, idk do something to stop this bullshit, let me actually have a 1v1 top lane for once.

replies.body:
No because league never will be and never has been a 1v1 game. I'm kinda confused about top lane atm. You have half the people wanting it to be a 1v1 island while the other half want more contribution over the rest of the map. Those two don't really mix. You can't have top lane be an island for 25 minutes while expecting to be relevant in the game.

Blast cone spawn time was pushed back. That makes it so junglers have to either:

A) walk all the way through river which spots them out on your ward much sooner

B) burn a gap closer over the wall which makes their gank much much weaker

If you don't ward then that's on you. LoL is not a 1v1 game. Top lane is not for 1v1s

Yes because asking not to be ganked by someone 1 level higher than you with full HP and double buffs at 2:30 before you can buy control wards and becoming a free bag of 400 gold is the same as asking to be left alone for 25 minutes. 

Riiiiiiiiight........
So what you're saying is you keep getting ganked at the exact same time every game. Riot should give us a free ward to place or something. Hmmmm

Read the OP again.

Towerdives.

They exist and they are stupidly easy to pull off right now.

This feels like pretty solid hyperbole here. Tower dives don't happen at lvl 2/3 period, and as Edat has pointed out a few times, with blast cone spawn being pushed back, the enemy has very obvious routes that you can ward, whether you do is up to you.

I've tower dove people and been dove at lvl 2/3 plenty of times. It is decently rare but it does happen and I don't know why you'd say it doesn't happen "period." I don't think calling out hyperbole with hyperbole is the answer. In top there aren't _that_ many gank routes but there are usually at least 3 viable ones if you're at all pushing and sometimes even if you aren't and you just can't keep it all warded by yourself.

In mid it feels like no matter what I ward I can be ganked from any direction without warning even if I'm playing reasonably safe. I literally avoided losing even my flash to a gank today in a game because I realized I'm close to lvl 3 but not quite there yet so obviously I'm about to get ganked and I backed up and missed a few cs just in time to barely avoid having to flash away from a J4 ganking me from behind the river wall in mid on my team's side of the map.

Avoiding ganks early relies heavily on your own jungler helping to scout and ward the enemy jungle and outside high ELO games that rarely happens.

Phew - yep, you're 100% correct here to call me out on my reply...well that's embarrassing. In my brain as I wrote that I was thinking "they happen super rarely" but didn't do anything to convey that and added a "period" to boot. Thanks for calling me out on a shitty contribution to the discussion...and even then it was hardly a "contribution".
Tower dive lvl 3 are not happening often ?{{champion:60}}

I think this just goes to show that even the best among us can be prone to the very same mistakes we trained ourselves against. We should still try not to argue using hyperbole, but hopefully this should make those instances a little more understandable, particularly since discussions like these can carry emotions from previous games or interactions.

What I think needs to stop, as well, is intervention that criticizes someone or their comment _purely_ on their form: sure, this thread's OP exaggerates many of its claims, as does the player you responded to, and criticizing that is fine, but criticizing _just_ that isn't, because people expect a more substantial response from a Rioter. Just by posting here, you've put an official stamp next to the thread that everyone on the front page of Gameplay will see, which will cause players to come here thinking that some Riot answer was given on the state of laning in top lane (this is, at any rate, what made me take a look here). It is disappointing to see a red response on the Gameplay Boards that doesn't say anything about the game or Riot's plans, but the fact that this response only tries to slap some random player on the wrist for poor typing form adds insult to injury.

I don't want this to come across as trying to discourage you from posting on the Boards, because I don't want that, but I do feel Gameplay should be a place for solid, gameplay-related discussion, and other sub-Boards exists for other topics (e.g. M&G or GD for non-serious discussion, Discuss the Boards/Player Behavior for player or Boards problems). As such, I and likely many other players would still be very interested in your thoughts on top lane and the state of the laning phase there. :)

Thanks for owning it.

Would love to hear from Riot about the issue I mentioned of how important junglers tracking enemy junglers is and how it almost never happens outside rather high ELO games, though preferably in a Riot created thread in the dev section. It feels like a completely different game when your team works together to track and respond to the enemy jungler. It strongly affects which champions should played, which runes to pick, how laning should be played, where to ward, and more. I think Riot can do better than essentially leaving low ELO players to suffer even if that particular player has learned just because their teammates have no clue about it.
In what elo are tower dives having succesfully at level 2/3?  I'm in plat and the tower dives I see that early are usually messed up.

I see them happening successfully at every ELO, though they're not as likely to work at low ELO and at really high ELOs they tend to happen less often right now, at least from what I've seen. Depends a bit on which champions people are and thus the frequency depends partly on which champs are meta at the moment. But even ones that aren't well suited to it do it at times too.

You're blatantly disregarding a lot here.

The ward cooldown at lower levels is considerably less than its uptime. It isn't hard to ping when your Lane opponent places a ward and your jungler can come by 1min15sec later guaranteed to be unseen.

Red side top Lane has two distinct gank paths, River and tribush. You can only ward one. It isn't that hard for the faster jungler to walk around Rift Herald and come from that side, especially if your Lane opponent pings that you deep warded River.

Tower dives DO happen at levels 2-3. They may not be often, but they do happen. It's as OP pointed out, the tower dive can happen if he sits back and lets his opponent push in a big wave. Normally it's the Lane bully pushing in that wave, and the Lane bully isn't typically tanky enough to do an early dive. If you're a high damage Lane bully without lots of tankiness getting pushed in by a tank because you're respecting the obvious enemy jungle gank, you're ready to be dove by a maokai or Sion etc... 

And as you specifically referred to Eedat's comment: I don't believe there's any inconsistency in what top Lane wants. The claim that 50% want a 1 on 1 Island while 50% want more interactivity with the team is simply false. 100% of people who play champions that have a decent Laning phase want the opportunity to win 1v1 before the jungler can decide the Lane. The ask has never been to have an island all game, it's to have 5 minutes or so to actually establish a lead before the jungler can camp you and make getting a lead impossible. If you're a Lane bully and can't get a lead by 5 min after minions spawned you probably didn't play great. If you're a Lane bully and didn't get a lead by 2:30 (the second wave of minions arrived in Lane) your opponent just didn't int. So obviously the people that play champions with weak Lane and strong scaling like it, that's no different than saying some people like yasuo buffs (people that would play yasuo) and some people don't (pretty much everyone else). 

Most top Lane players want agency and interactivity, but they also want an opportunity to actually showcase individual skill. Jungle has had too much threat to allow top Lane to have any agency whatsoever for more than a full season now. If junglers came on board a few minutes later, top Lane would get that full benefit of time to start getting a lead and transition it to the map. The lack of map presence isn't contradictory to wanting 1v1 early, it's actually complimentary.

Going to have disagree pretty hard here. It's not possible to solo ward all gank routes, even if you're buying a pink every back. And even if you do ward it and do see the jungler due to movement creep on all champions a lot of times you just can't back away in time. And even if you DO back away in time it's usually at the cost of a flash and massive amount of minions.

Now I could be wrong but I'm pretty sure the success rates on junglers making a successful kill has increased pretty signficantly over the past few years. I don't have access to the stats but I can say it certainly feels that way.

I've become a top lane main since our last run in on the boards good sir. I get my ass handed to me on occasion by early jungle pressure. It is my fault for tunneling and forgetting that the jungle would be there at 2:30.

Both teams have junglers. If their jungler is up top at 2:30, so is yours. If you are playing an early champ into nasus, OF COURSE a good jungle will gank your ass. A good jungle will gank 3-4 times. Cause you will be fed, and he will need to rescue his under farmed and weak nasus. 

It is the job of your jungle to A- Counter gank him and get you gold. or . B snowball bot and mid to hell while he is protecting nasus. It is your job to make that possible AND to make it easier for your jungle to gank by last hitting just underneath your turret range. 

Manipulate the minion wave, quit bitching jungle O.P when you are being stupid and you should KNOW it.  

And realize that this is a team game and Macro>Micro.
